005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model;
007
008import java.util.function.Predicate;
009
010import javax.xml.namespace.QName;
011
012import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
013import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.Nullable;
014
015public interface INamedModelInstance extends IModelInstance, INamedInstance {
016
017  /**
018   * Tests if the provided instance represents complex data. The data is complex
019   * if one of the following is true:
020   * <ul>
021   * <li>The instance is a {@link IAssemblyInstance}.</li>
022   * <li>The instance is a {@link IFieldInstance} that has flags.</li>
023   * </ul>
024   *
025   * This method can be used as a {@link Predicate}.
026   *
027   * @param instance
028   *          the instance to test
029   * @return {@code true} if the data is complex, or {@code false} otherwise
030   */
031  static boolean complexObjectFilter(INamedModelInstance instance) {
032    boolean retval = true;
033    if (instance instanceof IFieldInstance) {
034      IFieldInstance field = (IFieldInstance) instance;
035      retval = !field.getDefinition().getFlagInstances().isEmpty();
036    }
037    return retval;
038  }
039
040  @Override
041  @NonNull
042  IModelDefinition getDefinition();
043
044  /**
045   * Indicates if a flag's value can be used as a property name in the containing
046   * object in JSON who's value will be the object containing the flag. In such
047   * cases, the flag will not appear in the object. This is only allowed if the
048   * flag is required, as determined by a {@code true} result from
049   * {@link IFlagInstance#isRequired()}. The {@link IFlagInstance} can be
050   * retrieved using {@link #getEffectiveJsonKey()}.
051   *
052   * @return {@code true} if the flag's value can be used as a property name, or
053   *         {@code false} otherwise
054   * @see #getEffectiveJsonKey()
055   */
056  // TODO: remove once moved to the instance side
057  default boolean hasJsonKey() {
058    return getEffectiveJsonKey() != null;
059  }
060
061  /**
062   * Get the JSON key flag instance for this model instance, if one is configured.
063   *
064   * @return the JSON key flag instance or {@code null} if a JSON key is
065   *         configured
066   */
067  @Nullable
068  IFlagInstance getEffectiveJsonKey();
069
070  /**
071   * Get the JSON key associated with this instance.
072   *
073   * @return the configured JSON key or {@code null} if no JSON key is configured
074   */
075  @Nullable
076  IFlagInstance getJsonKey();
077
078  @Override
079  default QName getReferencedDefinitionQName() {
080    return getContainingModule().toModelQName(getName());
081  }
082
083  @Override
084  default QName getXmlQName() {
085    return getContainingModule().toModelQName(getEffectiveName());
086  }
087}
